titleStmt.title: Theodore Kohlhass et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG7787

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Winchester Ky Oct 30" 1862
His Ex'lly
Jas F. Robinson Esq Gov of Ky
A vacancy in the office of Justice of the peace in District No 4 in Clark County, has occurred by the election of E. T. Taylor as Presiding Judge of said County.
The Union people of said district desire the vacancy filled by the appt of Thacker Quisenberry who is a patriotic & intelligent resident of thie district & an unflinching Union man

Very resptfy &c
Theodore Kohlhass
A. H. Buckner
James Simpson
Chas Eginton

James T. Woodward had heretofore been recommended for the vacant office; but since then he has removed from the district. Mr. Quisenberry has heretofore been ^a^ Justice in that district, and his appt will be acceptable to the Union party of the district.

Clarke Co
J. P.
Dist No 4
Com Issd Nov. 1 1862
